snippet: Rights groups said police opened fire on a crowd of unarmed Tibetans who had gathered to celebrate the Dalai Lama’s birthday. Nine people were injured, two critically.
abstract: Human rights advocates report that Chinese police officers opened fire on crowd of Tibetans celebrating Dalai Lama's birthday in Sichuan Province, injuring nine people, two of them critically.
lead_paragraph: Rights groups said police opened fire on a crowd of unarmed Tibetans who had gathered to celebrate the Dalai Lama’s birthday. Nine people were injured, two critically.

headline.main: Chinese Police Said to Fire on Tibetans
headline.print_headline: Chinese Police Said to Fire on Tibetans
